thread.title: 5 veggie-heavy recipes to try this week
thread.title_full: 5 veggie-heavy recipes to try this week

author: Guest
title: 5 veggie-heavy recipes to try this week
text:
5 veggie-heavy recipes to try this week
This week's recipe roundup features meals that are heavy on fruit and veggies, but still quick and easy to make.
(5) updates to this series since
This twist on Cobb salad swaps in kale for lettuce and spiced butternut squash for chicken but keeps the essential avocado, blue cheese, bacon and egg.
Sheet pan meals have become so popular in the last few years. That’s because you cook everything on one pan, so cleanup is a cinch. This one-pan meal is such a great recipe because it satisfies the need to be Seriously Simple and is quite tasty.
This healthy soup recipe has a rich, yet light and velvety texture. Serve with crusty bread for dipping into the delicious broth.
Use the vibrant flavors of Creole cooking — a fusion of Spanish, French and African cuisines — to create this easy vegetarian dinner.
In the dead of winter, citrus gives our plates one big zap of color and flavor. We deserve this in excess. On snowbound days, I take refuge in our co-op's bounty of grapefruit (white, pink and ruby red), Cara Cara, navel and blood oranges, plus kumquats, limequats and tangerines. Arranged on a platter, these make an elegant first course, brunch side dish and an eye-catching dessert. Add a ...
